intro: Icacorea nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan coral tree, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
